data.name: p1_l1
data.value:
2012-13: Gateway Education (GE) courses:
GE1218, GE1220

data.name: p1_l2
data.value: Longer term plans include:

data.name: p1_l2_l1
data.value: An interdisciplinary Minor in Social Entrepreneurship

data.name: p1_l2_l2
data.value: Developing a Major and also a self-financing MA or M.Soc.Sci in Social Innovation and Entrepreneurship

data.name: p1_l2_l3
data.value: Self-financing entrepreneurial / innovation skill development programmes for practitioners to enhance and share their knowledge, competencies and insights.

data.name: p2_1
data.value: Student Service Leadership Development (SSLD) education shares common values and contents with the education that underpins social innovation and entrepreneurship.

data.name: p2_l1
data.value: GE courses: to deliver the core knowledge, skills, and values that buttress SSLD. These will include the specially tailored flagship course on Enhancing Your Service Leadership for the 21st Century. . The GE courses: Get Mad! (Make a Difference): the Challenge to Social Entrepreneurs; and Critical and Cultural Issues in Hong Kong's Service Economy will also contribute to SSLD education.

data.name: p2_l2
data.value: Student Internships: in Government, Business, Third Sector, and Socially Entrepreneurial Organizations that will enable students both to learn from and contribute to the organizations involved.

data.name: p2_l3
data.value: Student Entrepreneurship Experience: students will be coached by faculty and community experts to enter competitions for social entrepreneurship, e.g. the Social Enterprise Challenge open to all university students in Hong Kong.

data.name: p2_l4
data.value: Hands-on experience in implementing social enterprises tutored by faculty and practitioners.

data.name: p2_l5
data.value: Student Fellowships: for Advanced Students to participate in overseas courses and study tours, sharing their learning with peers on their return to Hong Kong (funding permitting).

data.name: p3_1
data.value: Social Innovation and Entrepreneurship are among the fastest growing areas of research across the social sciences and business management fields. Project Flame aspires to be a leader in regional and international SE / Innovation research and knowledge transfer.

data.name: p3_l1
data.value: Cross-disciplinary, local and international collaborative research on SE in Hong Kong and in worldwide

data.name: p3_l2
data.value: Major research themes could be drawn from key areas such as:

data.name: p3_l2_l1
data.value: Mapping the range and scope of local and regional SEs;

data.name: p3_l2_l10
data.value: Financing and resourcing means and models including self-generated revenue, start-up and other grants, micro-financing, venture philanthropy, impact investment, capital funds and social enterprise stock exchanges;

data.name: p3_l2_l11
data.value: Public policies, regulations and tax-regimes for social innovation and enterprise;

data.name: p3_l2_l12
data.value: SE sustainability and life-cycles from start-up, to growth, scaling-up, or to demise;

data.name: p3_l2_l13
data.value: SE market research, product design production, marketing;

data.name: p3_l2_l14
data.value: SE business and human resources management;

data.name: p3_l2_l15
data.value: SE social impact evaluation metrics, performance measurement;

data.name: p3_l2_l16
data.value: Scaling-up strategies for SEs including international branching, partnering, social franchising, transnational impact investment, etc.

data.name: p3_l2_l17
data.value: Sectoral studies - eg. social innovation and enterprise for resolving ageing and health care problems.

data.name: p3_l2_l2
data.value: Critical factors in social innovation and creativity;

data.name: p3_l2_l3
data.value: Critical factors in achieving SE success or failure;

data.name: p3_l2_l4
data.value: Strategies for harnessing new and existing technologies;

data.name: p3_l2_l5
data.value: Developing entrepreneurial solutions to social problems;

data.name: p3_l2_l6
data.value: Social goods and social value creation;

data.name: p3_l2_l7
data.value: Incubators for innovations in managing social and ecological challenges;

data.name: p3_l2_l8
data.value: The application of 'frugal technology' and new media to social problems;

data.name: p3_l2_l9
data.value: Cross-sectoral and stakeholder interactions;

data.name: p3_l3
data.value: Regular seminar series by scholars and practitioners

data.name: p3_l4
data.value: International workshop

data.name: p3_l5
data.value: Annual large-scale on-campus forum or fair

data.name: p3_l6
data.value: Publications and dissemination programme

data.name: p3_l7
data.value: Active participation in local and international conferences and networks

data.name: p4_1
data.value: Project Flame will function as a community-centred Collaborative Hub for the incubation and support of social innovation and entrepreneurship, providing a space for the exchange of innovative ideas, practices, and social interventions.

data.name: p4_l1
data.value: Learning Commons: a physical, intellectual, and human resource hub and reference centre for faculty, students and community organizations to come together to share and access information, brainstorm ideas, exchange practice insights, and work on collaborative projects.

data.name: p4_l2
data.value: "Social Entrepreneurs in Residence": outside experts spending time in CityU to share experiences, conduct research, organize master classes for agency heads and practitioners, hold seminars and workshops, and spearhead town-and-gown exchanges and international collaboration.

data.name: p4_l3
data.value: Case Bank on Social Entrepreneurship: inter-disciplinary teams of staff/ students / practitioners preparing case studies/reports, journal articles, and books and in various formats - print, slides, video or film. The aim is to build up a bank on best local and international practice for use in teaching, research, and idea incubation.

data.name: p4_l4
data.value: Staff development and networking: proactively seeking new learning opportunities and developing local and international networks and partnerships to ensure we keep abreast of innovation and current practices in social entrepreneurship and service leadership.
